<a id="TextServer"></a>

# TextServer

**Inherits:** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [TextServerExtension](TextServerExtension.md)

A server interface for font management and text rendering.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**TextServer** is the API backend for managing fonts and rendering text.

\ **Note:** This is a low-level API, consider using [TextLine](TextLine.md), [TextParagraph](TextParagraph.md), and [Font](Font.md) classes instead.

This is an abstract class, so to get the currently active **TextServer** instance, use the following code:




```gdscript
    var ts = TextServerManager.get_primary_interface()
```


```csharp
    var ts = TextServerManager.GetPrimaryInterface();
```

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Enumerations

<a id="enum_TextServer_FontAntialiasing"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **FontAntialiasing**: [](#enum_TextServer_FontAntialiasing)

<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_ANTIALIASING_NONE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontAntialiasing](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontAntialiasing) **FONT_ANTIALIASING_NONE** = `0`

Font glyphs are rasterized as 1-bit bitmaps.<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_ANTIALIASING_GRAY"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontAntialiasing](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontAntialiasing) **FONT_ANTIALIASING_GRAY** = `1`

Font glyphs are rasterized as 8-bit grayscale anti-aliased bitmaps.<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_ANTIALIASING_LCD"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontAntialiasing](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontAntialiasing) **FONT_ANTIALIASING_LCD** = `2`

Font glyphs are rasterized for LCD screens.

LCD subpixel layout is determined by the value of the [ProjectSettings.gui/theme/lcd_subpixel_layout](ProjectSettings.md#ProjectSettings_property_gui/theme/lcd_subpixel_layout) setting.

LCD subpixel anti-aliasing mode is suitable only for rendering horizontal, unscaled text in 2D.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_FontLCDSubpixelLayout"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **FontLCDSubpixelLayout**: [](#enum_TextServer_FontLCDSubpixelLayout)

<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_NONE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontLCDSubpixelLayout](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontLCDSubpixelLayout) **FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_NONE** = `0`

Unknown or unsupported subpixel layout, LCD subpixel antialiasing is disabled.<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_HRGB"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontLCDSubpixelLayout](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontLCDSubpixelLayout) **FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_HRGB** = `1`

Horizontal RGB subpixel layout.<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_HBGR"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontLCDSubpixelLayout](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontLCDSubpixelLayout) **FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_HBGR** = `2`

Horizontal BGR subpixel layout.<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_VRGB"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontLCDSubpixelLayout](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontLCDSubpixelLayout) **FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_VRGB** = `3`

Vertical RGB subpixel layout.<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_VBGR"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontLCDSubpixelLayout](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontLCDSubpixelLayout) **FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_VBGR** = `4`

Vertical BGR subpixel layout.<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_MAX"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontLCDSubpixelLayout](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontLCDSubpixelLayout) **FONT_LCD_SUBPIXEL_LAYOUT_MAX** = `5`

Represents the size of the [FontLCDSubpixelLayout](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontLCDSubpixelLayout) enum.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_Direction"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **Direction**: [](#enum_TextServer_Direction)

<a id="TextServer_constant_DIRECTION_AUTO"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Direction](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Direction) **DIRECTION_AUTO** = `0`

Text direction is determined based on contents and current locale.<a id="TextServer_constant_DIRECTION_LTR"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Direction](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Direction) **DIRECTION_LTR** = `1`

Text is written from left to right.<a id="TextServer_constant_DIRECTION_RTL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Direction](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Direction) **DIRECTION_RTL** = `2`

Text is written from right to left.<a id="TextServer_constant_DIRECTION_INHERITED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Direction](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Direction) **DIRECTION_INHERITED** = `3`

Text writing direction is the same as base string writing direction. Used for BiDi override only.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_Orientation"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **Orientation**: [](#enum_TextServer_Orientation)

<a id="TextServer_constant_ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Orientation](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Orientation) **ORIENTATION_HORIZONTAL** = `0`

Text is written horizontally.<a id="TextServer_constant_ORIENTATION_VERTICAL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Orientation](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Orientation) **ORIENTATION_VERTICAL** = `1`

Left to right text is written vertically from top to bottom.

Right to left text is written vertically from bottom to top.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

flags **JustificationFlag**: [](#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag)

<a id="TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_NONE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag) **JUSTIFICATION_NONE** = `0`

Do not justify text.<a id="TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_KASHIDA"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag) **JUSTIFICATION_KASHIDA** = `1`

Justify text by adding and removing kashidas.<a id="TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_WORD_BOUND"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag) **JUSTIFICATION_WORD_BOUND** = `2`

Justify text by changing width of the spaces between the words.<a id="TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_TRIM_EDGE_SPACES"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag) **JUSTIFICATION_TRIM_EDGE_SPACES** = `4`

Remove trailing and leading spaces from the justified text.<a id="TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_AFTER_LAST_TAB"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag) **JUSTIFICATION_AFTER_LAST_TAB** = `8`

Only apply justification to the part of the text after the last tab.<a id="TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_CONSTRAIN_ELLIPSIS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag) **JUSTIFICATION_CONSTRAIN_ELLIPSIS** = `16`

Apply justification to the trimmed line with ellipsis.<a id="TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag) **JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE** = `32`

Do not apply justification to the last line of the paragraph.<a id="TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE_WITH_VISIBLE_CHARS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag) **JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE_WITH_VISIBLE_CHARS** = `64`

Do not apply justification to the last line of the paragraph with visible characters (takes precedence over [JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE)).<a id="TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_DO_NOT_SKIP_SINGLE_LINE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag) **JUSTIFICATION_DO_NOT_SKIP_SINGLE_LINE** = `128`

Always apply justification to the paragraphs with a single line ([JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE) and [JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE_WITH_VISIBLE_CHARS](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_JUSTIFICATION_SKIP_LAST_LINE_WITH_VISIBLE_CHARS) are ignored).<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_AutowrapMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **AutowrapMode**: [](#enum_TextServer_AutowrapMode)

<a id="TextServer_constant_AUTOWRAP_OFF"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[AutowrapMode](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_AutowrapMode) **AUTOWRAP_OFF** = `0`

Autowrap is disabled.<a id="TextServer_constant_AUTOWRAP_ARBITRARY"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[AutowrapMode](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_AutowrapMode) **AUTOWRAP_ARBITRARY** = `1`

Wraps the text inside the node's bounding rectangle by allowing to break lines at arbitrary positions, which is useful when very limited space is available.<a id="TextServer_constant_AUTOWRAP_WORD"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[AutowrapMode](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_AutowrapMode) **AUTOWRAP_WORD** = `2`

Wraps the text inside the node's bounding rectangle by soft-breaking between words.<a id="TextServer_constant_AUTOWRAP_WORD_SMART"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[AutowrapMode](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_AutowrapMode) **AUTOWRAP_WORD_SMART** = `3`

Behaves similarly to [AUTOWRAP_WORD](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_AUTOWRAP_WORD), but force-breaks a word if that single word does not fit in one line.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

flags **LineBreakFlag**: [](#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag)

<a id="TextServer_constant_BREAK_NONE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[LineBreakFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag) **BREAK_NONE** = `0`

Do not break the line.<a id="TextServer_constant_BREAK_MANDATORY"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[LineBreakFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag) **BREAK_MANDATORY** = `1`

Break the line at the line mandatory break characters (e.g. ``"\n"``).<a id="TextServer_constant_BREAK_WORD_BOUND"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[LineBreakFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag) **BREAK_WORD_BOUND** = `2`

Break the line between the words.<a id="TextServer_constant_BREAK_GRAPHEME_BOUND"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[LineBreakFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag) **BREAK_GRAPHEME_BOUND** = `4`

Break the line between any unconnected graphemes.<a id="TextServer_constant_BREAK_ADAPTIVE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[LineBreakFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag) **BREAK_ADAPTIVE** = `8`

Should be used only in conjunction with [BREAK_WORD_BOUND](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_BREAK_WORD_BOUND), break the line between any unconnected graphemes, if it's impossible to break it between the words.<a id="TextServer_constant_BREAK_TRIM_EDGE_SPACES"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[LineBreakFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag) **BREAK_TRIM_EDGE_SPACES** = `16`

**Deprecated:** Use ``BREAK_TRIM_START_EDGE_SPACES | BREAK_TRIM_END_EDGE_SPACES`` instead.

Remove edge spaces from the broken line segments.<a id="TextServer_constant_BREAK_TRIM_INDENT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[LineBreakFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag) **BREAK_TRIM_INDENT** = `32`

Subtract first line indentation width from all lines after the first one.<a id="TextServer_constant_BREAK_TRIM_START_EDGE_SPACES"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[LineBreakFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag) **BREAK_TRIM_START_EDGE_SPACES** = `64`

Remove spaces and line break characters from the start of broken line segments.

E.g, after line breaking, the second segment of the following text ``test  \n  next``, is ``next`` if the flag is set, and ``  next`` if it is not.<a id="TextServer_constant_BREAK_TRIM_END_EDGE_SPACES"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[LineBreakFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_LineBreakFlag) **BREAK_TRIM_END_EDGE_SPACES** = `128`

Remove spaces and line break characters from the end of broken line segments.

E.g, after line breaking, the first segment of the following text ``test  \n  next``, is ``test`` if the flag is set, and ``test  \n`` if it is not.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_VisibleCharactersBehavior"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **VisibleCharactersBehavior**: [](#enum_TextServer_VisibleCharactersBehavior)

<a id="TextServer_constant_VC_CHARS_BEFORE_SHAPING"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[VisibleCharactersBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_VisibleCharactersBehavior) **VC_CHARS_BEFORE_SHAPING** = `0`

Trims text before the shaping. e.g, increasing [Label.visible_characters](Label.md#Label_property_visible_characters) or [RichTextLabel.visible_characters](RichTextLabel.md#RichTextLabel_property_visible_characters) value is visually identical to typing the text.

\ **Note:** In this mode, trimmed text is not processed at all. It is not accounted for in line breaking and size calculations.<a id="TextServer_constant_VC_CHARS_AFTER_SHAPING"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[VisibleCharactersBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_VisibleCharactersBehavior) **VC_CHARS_AFTER_SHAPING** = `1`

Displays glyphs that are mapped to the first [Label.visible_characters](Label.md#Label_property_visible_characters) or [RichTextLabel.visible_characters](RichTextLabel.md#RichTextLabel_property_visible_characters) characters from the beginning of the text.<a id="TextServer_constant_VC_GLYPHS_AUTO"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[VisibleCharactersBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_VisibleCharactersBehavior) **VC_GLYPHS_AUTO** = `2`

Displays [Label.visible_ratio](Label.md#Label_property_visible_ratio) or [RichTextLabel.visible_ratio](RichTextLabel.md#RichTextLabel_property_visible_ratio) glyphs, starting from the left or from the right, depending on [Control.layout_direction](Control.md#Control_property_layout_direction) value.<a id="TextServer_constant_VC_GLYPHS_LTR"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[VisibleCharactersBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_VisibleCharactersBehavior) **VC_GLYPHS_LTR** = `3`

Displays [Label.visible_ratio](Label.md#Label_property_visible_ratio) or [RichTextLabel.visible_ratio](RichTextLabel.md#RichTextLabel_property_visible_ratio) glyphs, starting from the left.<a id="TextServer_constant_VC_GLYPHS_RTL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[VisibleCharactersBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_VisibleCharactersBehavior) **VC_GLYPHS_RTL** = `4`

Displays [Label.visible_ratio](Label.md#Label_property_visible_ratio) or [RichTextLabel.visible_ratio](RichTextLabel.md#RichTextLabel_property_visible_ratio) glyphs, starting from the right.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **OverrunBehavior**: [](#enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior)

<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_NO_TRIMMING"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[OverrunBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior) **OVERRUN_NO_TRIMMING** = `0`

No text trimming is performed.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_TRIM_CHAR"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[OverrunBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior) **OVERRUN_TRIM_CHAR** = `1`

Trims the text per character.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_TRIM_WORD"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[OverrunBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior) **OVERRUN_TRIM_WORD** = `2`

Trims the text per word.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_TRIM_ELLIPSIS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[OverrunBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior) **OVERRUN_TRIM_ELLIPSIS** = `3`

Trims the text per character and adds an ellipsis to indicate that parts are hidden if trimmed text is 6 characters or longer.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_TRIM_WORD_ELLIPSIS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[OverrunBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior) **OVERRUN_TRIM_WORD_ELLIPSIS** = `4`

Trims the text per word and adds an ellipsis to indicate that parts are hidden if trimmed text is 6 characters or longer.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_TRIM_ELLIPSIS_FORCE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[OverrunBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior) **OVERRUN_TRIM_ELLIPSIS_FORCE** = `5`

Trims the text per character and adds an ellipsis to indicate that parts are hidden regardless of trimmed text length.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_TRIM_WORD_ELLIPSIS_FORCE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[OverrunBehavior](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_OverrunBehavior) **OVERRUN_TRIM_WORD_ELLIPSIS_FORCE** = `6`

Trims the text per word and adds an ellipsis to indicate that parts are hidden regardless of trimmed text length.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_TextOverrunFlag"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

flags **TextOverrunFlag**: [](#enum_TextServer_TextOverrunFlag)

<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_NO_TRIM"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TextOverrunFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_TextOverrunFlag) **OVERRUN_NO_TRIM** = `0`

No trimming is performed.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_TRIM"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TextOverrunFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_TextOverrunFlag) **OVERRUN_TRIM** = `1`

Trims the text when it exceeds the given width.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_TRIM_WORD_ONLY"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TextOverrunFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_TextOverrunFlag) **OVERRUN_TRIM_WORD_ONLY** = `2`

Trims the text per word instead of per grapheme.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_ADD_ELLIPSIS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TextOverrunFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_TextOverrunFlag) **OVERRUN_ADD_ELLIPSIS** = `4`

Determines whether an ellipsis should be added at the end of the text.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_ENFORCE_ELLIPSIS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TextOverrunFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_TextOverrunFlag) **OVERRUN_ENFORCE_ELLIPSIS** = `8`

Determines whether the ellipsis at the end of the text is enforced and may not be hidden.<a id="TextServer_constant_OVERRUN_JUSTIFICATION_AWARE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[TextOverrunFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_TextOverrunFlag) **OVERRUN_JUSTIFICATION_AWARE** = `16`

Accounts for the text being justified before attempting to trim it (see [JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag)).<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

flags **GraphemeFlag**: [](#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag)

<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_VALID"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

Grapheme is supported by the font, and can be drawn.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_RTL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_RTL** = `2`

Grapheme is part of right-to-left or bottom-to-top run.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_VIRTUAL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_VIRTUAL** = `4`

Grapheme is not part of source text, it was added by justification process.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_SPACE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_SPACE** = `8`

Grapheme is whitespace.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_BREAK_HARD"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_BREAK_HARD** = `16`

Grapheme is mandatory break point (e.g. ``"\n"``).<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_BREAK_SOFT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_BREAK_SOFT** = `32`

Grapheme is optional break point (e.g. space).<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_TAB"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_TAB** = `64`

Grapheme is the tabulation character.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_ELONGATION"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_ELONGATION** = `128`

Grapheme is kashida.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_PUNCTUATION"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_PUNCTUATION** = `256`

Grapheme is punctuation character.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_UNDERSCORE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_UNDERSCORE** = `512`

Grapheme is underscore character.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_CONNECTED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_CONNECTED** = `1024`

Grapheme is connected to the previous grapheme. Breaking line before this grapheme is not safe.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_SAFE_TO_INSERT_TATWEEL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_SAFE_TO_INSERT_TATWEEL** = `2048`

It is safe to insert a U+0640 before this grapheme for elongation.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_EMBEDDED_OBJECT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_EMBEDDED_OBJECT** = `4096`

Grapheme is an object replacement character for the embedded object.<a id="TextServer_constant_GRAPHEME_IS_SOFT_HYPHEN"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[GraphemeFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_GraphemeFlag) **GRAPHEME_IS_SOFT_HYPHEN** = `8192`

Grapheme is a soft hyphen.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_Hinting"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **Hinting**: [](#enum_TextServer_Hinting)

<a id="TextServer_constant_HINTING_NONE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Hinting](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Hinting) **HINTING_NONE** = `0`

Disables font hinting (smoother but less crisp).<a id="TextServer_constant_HINTING_LIGHT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Hinting](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Hinting) **HINTING_LIGHT** = `1`

Use the light font hinting mode.<a id="TextServer_constant_HINTING_NORMAL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Hinting](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Hinting) **HINTING_NORMAL** = `2`

Use the default font hinting mode (crisper but less smooth).

\ **Note:** This hinting mode changes both horizontal and vertical glyph metrics. If applied to monospace font, some glyphs might have different width.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **SubpixelPositioning**: [](#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning)

<a id="TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_DISABLED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SubpixelPositioning](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning) **SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_DISABLED** = `0`

Glyph horizontal position is rounded to the whole pixel size, each glyph is rasterized once.<a id="TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_AUTO"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SubpixelPositioning](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning) **SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_AUTO** = `1`

Glyph horizontal position is rounded based on font size.

- To one quarter of the pixel size if font size is smaller or equal to [SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_QUARTER_MAX_SIZE](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_QUARTER_MAX_SIZE).

- To one half of the pixel size if font size is smaller or equal to [SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_HALF_MAX_SIZE](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_HALF_MAX_SIZE).

- To the whole pixel size for larger fonts.<a id="TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_HALF"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SubpixelPositioning](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning) **SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_HALF** = `2`

Glyph horizontal position is rounded to one half of the pixel size, each glyph is rasterized up to two times.<a id="TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_QUARTER"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SubpixelPositioning](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning) **SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_QUARTER** = `3`

Glyph horizontal position is rounded to one quarter of the pixel size, each glyph is rasterized up to four times.<a id="TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_HALF_MAX_SIZE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SubpixelPositioning](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning) **SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_HALF_MAX_SIZE** = `20`

Maximum font size which will use "one half of the pixel" subpixel positioning in [SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_AUTO](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_AUTO) mode.<a id="TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_QUARTER_MAX_SIZE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[SubpixelPositioning](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SubpixelPositioning) **SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_ONE_QUARTER_MAX_SIZE** = `16`

Maximum font size which will use "one quarter of the pixel" subpixel positioning in [SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_AUTO](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_SUBPIXEL_POSITIONING_AUTO) mode.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Feature](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Feature) **FEATURE_FONT_SYSTEM** = `512`

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Feature](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Feature) **FEATURE_USE_SUPPORT_DATA** = `4096`

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Feature](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Feature) **FEATURE_UNICODE_IDENTIFIERS** = `8192`

TextServer supports UAX #31 identifier validation, see [is_valid_identifier()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_is_valid_identifier).<a id="TextServer_constant_FEATURE_UNICODE_SECURITY"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[Feature](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Feature) **FEATURE_UNICODE_SECURITY** = `16384`

TextServer supports [Unicode Technical Report #36](https://unicode.org/reports/tr36/) and [Unicode Technical Standard #39](https://unicode.org/reports/tr39/) based spoof detection features.<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_ContourPointTag"></a>

<a id="enum_TextServer_FontStyle"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

flags **FontStyle**: [](#enum_TextServer_FontStyle)

<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_BOLD"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontStyle](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontStyle) **FONT_BOLD** = `1`

Font is bold.<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_ITALIC"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontStyle](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontStyle) **FONT_ITALIC** = `2`

Font is italic or oblique.<a id="TextServer_constant_FONT_FIXED_WIDTH"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FontStyle](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontStyle) **FONT_FIXED_WIDTH** = `4`

Font has fixed-width characters (also known as monospace).<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_TextServer_StructuredTextParser"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **StructuredTextParser**: [](#enum_TextServer_StructuredTextParser)

<a id="TextServer_constant_STRUCTURED_TEXT_DEFAULT"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[StructuredTextParser](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_StructuredTextParser) **STRUCTURED_TEXT_DEFAULT** = `0`

Use default Unicode BiDi algorithm.<a id="TextServer_constant_STRUCTURED_TEXT_URI"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[StructuredTextParser](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_StructuredTextParser) **STRUCTURED_TEXT_URI** = `1`

BiDi override for URI.<a id="TextServer_constant_STRUCTURED_TEXT_FILE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[StructuredTextParser](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_StructuredTextParser) **STRUCTURED_TEXT_FILE** = `2`

BiDi override for file path.<a id="TextServer_constant_STRUCTURED_TEXT_EMAIL"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[StructuredTextParser](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_StructuredTextParser) **STRUCTURED_TEXT_EMAIL** = `3`

<a id="enum_TextServer_FixedSizeScaleMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **FixedSizeScaleMode**: [](#enum_TextServer_FixedSizeScaleMode)

<a id="TextServer_constant_FIXED_SIZE_SCALE_DISABLE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FixedSizeScaleMode](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FixedSizeScaleMode) **FIXED_SIZE_SCALE_DISABLE** = `0`

Bitmap font is not scaled.<a id="TextServer_constant_FIXED_SIZE_SCALE_INTEGER_ONLY"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FixedSizeScaleMode](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FixedSizeScaleMode) **FIXED_SIZE_SCALE_INTEGER_ONLY** = `1`

Bitmap font is scaled to the closest integer multiple of the font's fixed size. This is the recommended option for pixel art fonts.<a id="TextServer_constant_FIXED_SIZE_SCALE_ENABLED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[FixedSizeScaleMode](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FixedSizeScaleMode) **FIXED_SIZE_SCALE_ENABLED** = `2`

Bitmap font is scaled to an arbitrary (fractional) size. This is the recommended option for non-pixel art fonts.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="TextServer_method_create_font"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[RID](RID.md) **create_font**\ (\ ) [](#TextServer_method_create_font)

Creates a new, empty font cache entry resource. To free the resulting resource, use the [free_rid()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_free_rid) method.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_create_font_linked_variation"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[RID](RID.md) **create_font_linked_variation**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_create_font_linked_variation)

Creates a new variation existing font which is reusing the same glyph cache and font data. To free the resulting resource, use the [free_rid()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_free_rid) method.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_create_shaped_text"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[RID](RID.md) **create_shaped_text**\ (\ direction\: [Direction](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Direction) = 0, orientation\: [Orientation](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Orientation) = 0\ ) [](#TextServer_method_create_shaped_text)

Creates a new buffer for complex text layout, with the given `direction` and `orientation`. To free the resulting buffer, use [free_rid()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_free_rid) method.

\ **Note:** Direction is ignored if server does not support [FEATURE_BIDI_LAYOUT](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_BIDI_LAYOUT) feature (supported by [TextServerAdvanced](TextServerAdvanced.md)).

\ **Note:** Orientation is ignored if server does not support [FEATURE_VERTICAL_LAYOUT](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_VERTICAL_LAYOUT) feature (supported by [TextServerAdvanced](TextServerAdvanced.md)).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_draw_hex_code_box"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **draw_hex_code_box**\ (\ canvas\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), pos\: [Vector2](Vector2.md), index\: [int](int.md), color\: [Color](Color.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_draw_hex_code_box)

Draws box displaying character hexadecimal code. Used for replacing missing characters.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_clear_glyphs"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_clear_glyphs**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_clear_glyphs)

Removes all rendered glyph information from the cache entry.

\ **Note:** This function will not remove textures associated with the glyphs, use [font_remove_texture()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_remove_texture) to remove them manually.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_clear_kerning_map"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_clear_kerning_map**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_clear_kerning_map)

Removes all kerning overrides.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_clear_size_cache"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_clear_size_cache**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_clear_size_cache)

Removes all font sizes from the cache entry.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_clear_system_fallback_cache"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_clear_system_fallback_cache**\ (\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_clear_system_fallback_cache)

Frees all automatically loaded system fonts.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_clear_textures"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_clear_textures**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_clear_textures)

Removes all textures from font cache entry.

\ **Note:** This function will not remove glyphs associated with the texture, use [font_remove_glyph()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_remove_glyph) to remove them manually.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_draw_glyph"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_draw_glyph**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), canvas\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), pos\: [Vector2](Vector2.md), index\: [int](int.md), color\: [Color](Color.md) = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling\: [float](float.md) = 0.0\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_draw_glyph)

Draws single glyph into a canvas item at the position, using `font_rid` at the size `size`. If `oversampling` is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.

\ **Note:** Glyph index is specific to the font, use glyphs indices returned by [shaped_text_get_glyphs()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_shaped_text_get_glyphs) or [font_get_glyph_index()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_index).

\ **Note:** If there are pending glyphs to render, calling this function might trigger the texture cache update.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_draw_glyph_outline"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_draw_glyph_outline**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), canvas\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), outline_size\: [int](int.md), pos\: [Vector2](Vector2.md), index\: [int](int.md), color\: [Color](Color.md) = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling\: [float](float.md) = 0.0\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_draw_glyph_outline)

Draws single glyph outline of size `outline_size` into a canvas item at the position, using `font_rid` at the size `size`. If `oversampling` is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.

\ **Note:** Glyph index is specific to the font, use glyphs indices returned by [shaped_text_get_glyphs()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_shaped_text_get_glyphs) or [font_get_glyph_index()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_index).

\ **Note:** If there are pending glyphs to render, calling this function might trigger the texture cache update.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_antialiasing"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[FontAntialiasing](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontAntialiasing) **font_get_antialiasing**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_antialiasing)

Returns font anti-aliasing mode.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_ascent"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **font_get_ascent**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_ascent)

Returns the font ascent (number of pixels above the baseline).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_baseline_offset"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **font_get_baseline_offset**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_baseline_offset)

Returns extra baseline offset (as a fraction of font height).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_char_from_glyph_index"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **font_get_char_from_glyph_index**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), glyph_index\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_char_from_glyph_index)

Returns character code associated with `glyph_index`, or ``0`` if `glyph_index` is invalid. See [font_get_glyph_index()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_index).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_descent"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **font_get_descent**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_descent)

Returns the font descent (number of pixels below the baseline).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_disable_embedded_bitmaps"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **font_get_disable_embedded_bitmaps**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_disable_embedded_bitmaps)

Returns whether the font's embedded bitmap loading is disabled.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_embolden"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Returns font embolden strength.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_face_count"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_face_index"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_fixed_size_scale_mode"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_generate_mipmaps"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_global_oversampling"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

**Deprecated:** Use [Viewport](Viewport.md) oversampling, or the ``oversampling`` argument of the ``draw_*`` methods instead.

Deprecated. This method always returns ``1.0``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_advance"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **font_get_glyph_advance**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), glyph\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_advance)

Returns glyph advance (offset of the next glyph).

\ **Note:** Advance for glyphs outlines is the same as the base glyph advance and is not saved.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_contours"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **font_get_glyph_contours**\ (\ font\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), index\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_contours)

Returns outline contours of the glyph as a [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) with the following contents:

\ ``points``         - [PackedVector3Array](PackedVector3Array.md), containing outline points. ``x`` and ``y`` are point coordinates. ``z`` is the type of the point, using the [ContourPointTag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_ContourPointTag) values.

\ ``contours``       - [PackedInt32Array](PackedInt32Array.md), containing indices the end points of each contour.

\ ``orientation``    - [bool](bool.md), contour orientation. If ``true``, clockwise contours must be filled.

- Two successive [CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_ON](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_ON) points indicate a line segment.

- One [CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_OFF_CONIC](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_OFF_CONIC) point between two [CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_ON](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_ON) points indicates a single conic (quadratic) Bzier arc.

- Two [CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_OFF_CUBIC](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_OFF_CUBIC) points between two [CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_ON](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_ON) points indicate a single cubic Bzier arc.

- Two successive [CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_OFF_CONIC](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_OFF_CONIC) points indicate two successive conic (quadratic) Bzier arcs with a virtual [CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_ON](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_ON) point at their middle.

- Each contour is closed. The last point of a contour uses the first point of a contour as its next point, and vice versa. The first point can be [CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_OFF_CONIC](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_CONTOUR_CURVE_TAG_OFF_CONIC) point.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_index"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **font_get_glyph_index**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), char\: [int](int.md), variation_selector\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_index)

Returns the glyph index of a `char`, optionally modified by the `variation_selector`. See [font_get_char_from_glyph_index()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_get_char_from_glyph_index).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_glyph_texture_idx"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

\ **Note:** If there are pending glyphs to render, calling this function might trigger the texture cache update.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_keep_rounding_remainders"></a>

Returns glyph position rounding behavior. If set to ``true``, when aligning glyphs to the pixel boundaries rounding remainders are accumulated to ensure more uniform glyph distribution. This setting has no effect if subpixel positioning is enabled.

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_ot_name_strings"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **font_get_ot_name_strings**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_ot_name_strings)

Returns [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) with OpenType font name strings (localized font names, version, description, license information, sample text, etc.).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_oversampling"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **font_get_oversampling**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_oversampling)

Returns oversampling factor override. If set to a positive value, overrides the oversampling factor of the viewport this font is used in. See [Viewport.oversampling](Viewport.md#Viewport_property_oversampling). This value doesn't override the ``oversampling`` parameter of ``draw_*`` methods. Used by dynamic fonts only.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **font_get_scale**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_scale)

Returns scaling factor of the color bitmap font.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_script_support_override"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **font_get_script_support_override**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), script\: [String](String.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_get_script_support_override)

Returns ``true`` if support override is enabled for the `script`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_script_support_overrides"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) **font_get_script_support_overrides**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_get_script_support_overrides)

Returns list of script support overrides.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_size_cache_info"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md)\[[Dictionary](Dictionary.md)\] **font_get_size_cache_info**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_size_cache_info)

Returns font cache information, each entry contains the following fields: ``Vector2i size_px`` - font size in pixels, ``float viewport_oversampling`` - viewport oversampling factor, ``int glyphs`` - number of rendered glyphs, ``int textures`` - number of used textures, ``int textures_size`` - size of texture data in bytes.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_size_cache_list"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md)\[[Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\] **font_get_size_cache_list**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_size_cache_list)

Returns list of the font sizes in the cache. Each size is [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) with font size and outline size.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_spacing"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **font_get_spacing**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), spacing\: [SpacingType](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SpacingType)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_spacing)

Returns the spacing for `spacing` in pixels (not relative to the font size).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_stretch"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **font_get_stretch**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_stretch)

Returns font stretch amount, compared to a normal width. A percentage value between ``50%`` and ``200%``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_style"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_subpixel_positioning"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_supported_chars"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_texture_offsets"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_variation_coordinates"></a>

Returns variation coordinates for the specified font cache entry. See [font_supported_variation_list()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_supported_variation_list) for more info.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_get_weight"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **font_get_weight**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_font_get_weight)

Returns weight (boldness) of the font. A value in the ``100...999`` range, normal font weight is ``400``, bold font weight is ``700``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_has_char"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Returns ``true`` if a Unicode `char` is available in the font.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_is_force_autohinter"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

Returns ``true``, if font supports given language ([ISO 639](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_639-1) code).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

Returns ``true``, if color modulation is applied when drawing colored glyphs.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_is_multichannel_signed_distance_field"></a>

Returns ``true`` if glyphs of all sizes are rendered using single multichannel signed distance field generated from the dynamic font vector data.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_is_script_supported"></a>

Returns ``true``, if font supports given script (ISO 15924 code).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_remove_glyph"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_remove_glyph**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), glyph\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_remove_glyph)

Removes specified rendered glyph information from the cache entry.

\ **Note:** This function will not remove textures associated with the glyphs, use [font_remove_texture()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_remove_texture) to remove them manually.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_remove_texture"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Removes specified texture from the cache entry.

\ **Note:** This function will not remove glyphs associated with the texture, remove them manually, using [font_remove_glyph()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_remove_glyph).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_disable_embedded_bitmaps"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_disable_embedded_bitmaps**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), disable_embedded_bitmaps\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_disable_embedded_bitmaps)

If set to ``true``, embedded font bitmap loading is disabled (bitmap-only and color fonts ignore this property).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_embolden"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_embolden**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), strength\: [float](float.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_embolden)

Sets font embolden strength. If `strength` is not equal to zero, emboldens the font outlines. Negative values reduce the outline thickness.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_face_index"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Sets an active face index in the TrueType / OpenType collection.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_fixed_size"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_fixed_size**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), fixed_size\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_fixed_size)

Sets bitmap font fixed size. If set to value greater than zero, same cache entry will be used for all font sizes.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_fixed_size_scale_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_fixed_size_scale_mode**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), fixed_size_scale_mode\: [FixedSizeScaleMode](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FixedSizeScaleMode)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_fixed_size_scale_mode)

Sets bitmap font scaling mode. This property is used only if ``fixed_size`` is greater than zero.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_force_autohinter"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_force_autohinter**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), force_autohinter\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_force_autohinter)

If set to ``true`` auto-hinting is preferred over font built-in hinting.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_generate_mipmaps"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_generate_mipmaps**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), generate_mipmaps\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_generate_mipmaps)

If set to ``true`` font texture mipmap generation is enabled.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_global_oversampling"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_global_oversampling**\ (\ oversampling\: [float](float.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_global_oversampling)

**Deprecated:** Use [Viewport](Viewport.md) oversampling, or the ``oversampling`` argument of the ``draw_*`` methods instead.

Deprecated. This method does nothing.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_glyph_advance"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_glyph_advance**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), glyph\: [int](int.md), advance\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_glyph_advance)

Sets glyph advance (offset of the next glyph).

\ **Note:** Advance for glyphs outlines is the same as the base glyph advance and is not saved.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_glyph_offset"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_glyph_offset**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), glyph\: [int](int.md), offset\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_glyph_offset)

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_glyph_size"></a>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_glyph_texture_idx"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_glyph_texture_idx**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), glyph\: [int](int.md), texture_idx\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_glyph_texture_idx)

Sets index of the cache texture containing the glyph.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_glyph_uv_rect"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_glyph_uv_rect**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), glyph\: [int](int.md), uv_rect\: [Rect2](Rect2.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_glyph_uv_rect)

Sets rectangle in the cache texture containing the glyph.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_hinting"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_hinting**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), hinting\: [Hinting](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Hinting)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_hinting)

Sets font hinting mode. Used by dynamic fonts only.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_keep_rounding_remainders"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_keep_rounding_remainders**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), keep_rounding_remainders\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_keep_rounding_remainders)

Sets glyph position rounding behavior. If set to ``true``, when aligning glyphs to the pixel boundaries rounding remainders are accumulated to ensure more uniform glyph distribution. This setting has no effect if subpixel positioning is enabled.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_kerning"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_kerning**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), glyph_pair\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md), kerning\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_kerning)

Sets kerning for the pair of glyphs.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_language_support_override"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_language_support_override**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), language\: [String](String.md), supported\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_language_support_override)

Adds override for [font_is_language_supported()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_is_language_supported).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_modulate_color_glyphs"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_modulate_color_glyphs**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), force_autohinter\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_modulate_color_glyphs)

If set to ``true``, color modulation is applied when drawing colored glyphs, otherwise it's applied to the monochrome glyphs only.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_msdf_pixel_range"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_msdf_pixel_range**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), msdf_pixel_range\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_msdf_pixel_range)

Sets the width of the range around the shape between the minimum and maximum representable signed distance.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_msdf_size"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_msdf_size**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), msdf_size\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_msdf_size)

Sets source font size used to generate MSDF textures.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_multichannel_signed_distance_field"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_multichannel_signed_distance_field**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), msdf\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_multichannel_signed_distance_field)

If set to ``true``, glyphs of all sizes are rendered using single multichannel signed distance field generated from the dynamic font vector data. MSDF rendering allows displaying the font at any scaling factor without blurriness, and without incurring a CPU cost when the font size changes (since the font no longer needs to be rasterized on the CPU). As a downside, font hinting is not available with MSDF. The lack of font hinting may result in less crisp and less readable fonts at small sizes.

\ **Note:** MSDF font rendering does not render glyphs with overlapping shapes correctly. Overlapping shapes are not valid per the OpenType standard, but are still commonly found in many font files, especially those converted by Google Fonts. To avoid issues with overlapping glyphs, consider downloading the font file directly from the type foundry instead of relying on Google Fonts.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_name"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_name**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), name\: [String](String.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_name)

Sets the font family name.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_opentype_feature_overrides"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_opentype_feature_overrides**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), overrides\: [Dictionary](Dictionary.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_opentype_feature_overrides)

Sets font OpenType feature set override.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_oversampling"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_oversampling**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), oversampling\: [float](float.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_oversampling)

If set to a positive value, overrides the oversampling factor of the viewport this font is used in. See [Viewport.oversampling](Viewport.md#Viewport_property_oversampling). This value doesn't override the ``oversampling`` parameter of ``draw_*`` methods. Used by dynamic fonts only.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Sets scaling factor of the color bitmap font.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

Adds override for [font_is_script_supported()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_is_script_supported).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_spacing"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_spacing**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), spacing\: [SpacingType](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SpacingType), value\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_spacing)

Sets the spacing for `spacing` to `value` in pixels (not relative to the font size).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_stretch"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_stretch**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), weight\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_stretch)

Sets font stretch amount, compared to a normal width. A percentage value between ``50%`` and ``200%``.

\ **Note:** This value is used for font matching only and will not affect font rendering. Use [font_set_face_index()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_face_index), [font_set_variation_coordinates()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_variation_coordinates), or [font_set_transform()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_transform) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_style"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_style**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), style\: **BitField**\[[FontStyle](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_FontStyle)\]\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_style)

Sets the font style flags.

\ **Note:** This value is used for font matching only and will not affect font rendering. Use [font_set_face_index()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_face_index), [font_set_variation_coordinates()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_variation_coordinates), [font_set_embolden()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_embolden), or [font_set_transform()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_transform) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

Sets array containing glyph packing data.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_transform"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_transform**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), transform\: [Transform2D](Transform2D.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_transform)

Sets 2D transform, applied to the font outlines, can be used for slanting, flipping, and rotating glyphs.

For example, to simulate italic typeface by slanting, apply the following transform ``Transform2D(1.0, slant, 0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 0.0)``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_underline_position"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_underline_position**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), size\: [int](int.md), underline_position\: [float](float.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_underline_position)

Sets pixel offset of the underline below the baseline.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_underline_thickness"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

Sets thickness of the underline in pixels.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_variation_coordinates"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_variation_coordinates**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), variation_coordinates\: [Dictionary](Dictionary.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_variation_coordinates)

Sets variation coordinates for the specified font cache entry. See [font_supported_variation_list()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_supported_variation_list) for more info.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_font_set_weight"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **font_set_weight**\ (\ font_rid\: [RID](RID.md), weight\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_font_set_weight)

Sets weight (boldness) of the font. A value in the ``100...999`` range, normal font weight is ``400``, bold font weight is ``700``.

\ **Note:** This value is used for font matching only and will not affect font rendering. Use [font_set_face_index()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_face_index), [font_set_variation_coordinates()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_variation_coordinates), or [font_set_embolden()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_font_set_embolden) instead.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_is_confusable"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **is_confusable**\ (\ string\: [String](String.md), dict\: [PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_is_confusable)

Returns index of the first string in `dict` which is visually confusable with the `string`, or ``-1`` if none is found.

\ **Note:** This method doesn't detect invisible characters, for spoof detection use it in combination with [spoof_check()](TextServer.md#TextServer_method_spoof_check).

\ **Note:** Always returns ``-1`` if the server does not support the [FEATURE_UNICODE_SECURITY](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_UNICODE_SECURITY) feature.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_is_locale_right_to_left"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_locale_right_to_left**\ (\ locale\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_is_locale_right_to_left)

Returns ``true`` if locale is right-to-left.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_is_valid_identifier"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_valid_identifier**\ (\ string\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_is_valid_identifier)

Returns ``true`` if `string` is a valid identifier.

If the text server supports the [FEATURE_UNICODE_IDENTIFIERS](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_UNICODE_IDENTIFIERS) feature, a valid identifier must:

- Conform to normalization form C.

- Begin with a Unicode character of class XID_Start or ``"_"``.

- May contain Unicode characters of class XID_Continue in the other positions.

- Use UAX #31 recommended scripts only (mixed scripts are allowed).

If the [FEATURE_UNICODE_IDENTIFIERS](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_UNICODE_IDENTIFIERS) feature is not supported, a valid identifier must:

- Begin with a Unicode character of class XID_Start or ``"_"``.

- May contain Unicode characters of class XID_Continue in the other positions.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_is_valid_letter"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **is_valid_letter**\ (\ unicode\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_is_valid_letter)

Returns ``true`` if the given code point is a valid letter, i.e. it belongs to the Unicode category "L".

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_add_string"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **shaped_text_add_string**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md), text\: [String](String.md), fonts\: [Array](Array.md)\[[RID](RID.md)\], size\: [int](int.md), opentype_features\: [Dictionary](Dictionary.md) = \{\}, language\: [String](String.md) = "", meta\: [Variant](Variant.md) = null\ ) [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_add_string)

Adds text span and font to draw it to the text buffer.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_clear"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **shaped_text_clear**\ (\ rid\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_clear)

Clears text buffer (removes text and inline objects).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_closest_character_pos"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **shaped_text_closest_character_pos**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md), pos\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_closest_character_pos)

Returns composite character position closest to the `pos`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_draw"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **shaped_text_draw**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md), canvas\: [RID](RID.md), pos\: [Vector2](Vector2.md), clip_l\: [float](float.md) = -1, clip_r\: [float](float.md) = -1, color\: [Color](Color.md) = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling\: [float](float.md) = 0.0\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_draw)

Draw shaped text into a canvas item at a given position, with `color`. `pos` specifies the leftmost point of the baseline (for horizontal layout) or topmost point of the baseline (for vertical layout). If `oversampling` is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.

\ `clip_l` and `clip_r` are offsets relative to `pos`, going to the right in horizontal layout and downward in vertical layout. If `clip_l` is not negative, glyphs starting before the offset are clipped. If `clip_r` is not negative, glyphs ending after the offset are clipped.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_draw_outline"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **shaped_text_draw_outline**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md), canvas\: [RID](RID.md), pos\: [Vector2](Vector2.md), clip_l\: [float](float.md) = -1, clip_r\: [float](float.md) = -1, outline_size\: [int](int.md) = 1, color\: [Color](Color.md) = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), oversampling\: [float](float.md) = 0.0\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_draw_outline)

Draw the outline of the shaped text into a canvas item at a given position, with `color`. `pos` specifies the leftmost point of the baseline (for horizontal layout) or topmost point of the baseline (for vertical layout). If `oversampling` is greater than zero, it is used as font oversampling factor, otherwise viewport oversampling settings are used.

\ `clip_l` and `clip_r` are offsets relative to `pos`, going to the right in horizontal layout and downward in vertical layout. If `clip_l` is not negative, glyphs starting before the offset are clipped. If `clip_r` is not negative, glyphs ending after the offset are clipped.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_fit_to_width"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **shaped_text_fit_to_width**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md), width\: [float](float.md), justification_flags\: **BitField**\[[JustificationFlag](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_JustificationFlag)\] = 3\ ) [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_fit_to_width)

Adjusts text width to fit to specified width, returns new text width.

\ **Note:** Overall ascent can be higher than font ascent, if some glyphs are displaced from the baseline.

Returns shapes of the carets corresponding to the character offset `position` in the text. Returned caret shape is 1 pixel wide rectangle.

Override ranges should cover full source text without overlaps. BiDi algorithm will be used on each range separately.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_set_direction"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **shaped_text_set_direction**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md), direction\: [Direction](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_Direction) = 0\ ) [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_set_direction)

Sets desired text direction. If set to [DIRECTION_AUTO](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_DIRECTION_AUTO), direction will be detected based on the buffer contents and current locale.

\ **Note:** Direction is ignored if server does not support [FEATURE_BIDI_LAYOUT](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_BIDI_LAYOUT) feature (supported by [TextServerAdvanced](TextServerAdvanced.md)).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

Sets desired text orientation.

\ **Note:** Orientation is ignored if server does not support [FEATURE_VERTICAL_LAYOUT](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_VERTICAL_LAYOUT) feature (supported by [TextServerAdvanced](TextServerAdvanced.md)).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_set_preserve_invalid"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **shaped_text_set_preserve_invalid**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md), enabled\: [bool](bool.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_set_preserve_invalid)

If set to ``true`` text buffer will display invalid characters as hexadecimal codes, otherwise nothing is displayed.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_set_spacing"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **shaped_text_set_spacing**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md), spacing\: [SpacingType](TextServer.md#enum_TextServer_SpacingType), value\: [int](int.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_set_spacing)

Sets extra spacing added between glyphs or lines in pixels.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_shaped_text_shape"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **shaped_text_shape**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md)\ ) [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_shape)

Shapes buffer if it's not shaped. Returns ``true`` if the string is shaped successfully.

\ **Note:** It is not necessary to call this function manually, buffer will be shaped automatically as soon as any of its output data is requested.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-method -->

Returns text glyphs in the logical order.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-method -->

[RID](RID.md) **shaped_text_substr**\ (\ shaped\: [RID](RID.md), start\: [int](int.md), length\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_shaped_text_substr)

Returns text buffer for the substring of the text in the `shaped` text buffer (including inline objects).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_spoof_check"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](bool.md) **spoof_check**\ (\ string\: [String](String.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_spoof_check)

Returns ``true`` if `string` is likely to be an attempt at confusing the reader.

\ **Note:** Always returns ``false`` if the server does not support the [FEATURE_UNICODE_SECURITY](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_UNICODE_SECURITY) feature.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_string_get_character_breaks"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PackedInt32Array](PackedInt32Array.md) **string_get_character_breaks**\ (\ string\: [String](String.md), language\: [String](String.md) = ""\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_string_get_character_breaks)

Returns array of the composite character boundaries.

```
    var ts = TextServerManager.get_primary_interface()
    print(ts.string_get_character_breaks("Test  Test")) # Prints [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14]
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_string_get_word_breaks"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PackedInt32Array](PackedInt32Array.md) **string_get_word_breaks**\ (\ string\: [String](String.md), language\: [String](String.md) = "", chars_per_line\: [int](int.md) = 0\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_string_get_word_breaks)

Returns an array of the word break boundaries. Elements in the returned array are the offsets of the start and end of words. Therefore the length of the array is always even.

When `chars_per_line` is greater than zero, line break boundaries are returned instead.

```
    var ts = TextServerManager.get_primary_interface()
    # Corresponds to the substrings "The", "Redot", "Engine", and "4".
    print(ts.string_get_word_breaks("The Redot Engine, 4")) # Prints [0, 3, 4, 9, 10, 16, 18, 19]
    # Corresponds to the substrings "The", "Redot", "Engin", and "e, 4".
    print(ts.string_get_word_breaks("The Redot Engine, 4", "en", 5)) # Prints [0, 3, 4, 9, 10, 15, 15, 19]
    # Corresponds to the substrings "The Redot" and "Engine, 4".
    print(ts.string_get_word_breaks("The Redot Engine, 4", "en", 10)) # Prints [0, 9, 10, 19]
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="TextServer_method_string_to_lower"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **string_to_lower**\ (\ string\: [String](String.md), language\: [String](String.md) = ""\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_string_to_lower)

Returns the string converted to lowercase.

\ **Note:** Casing is locale dependent and context sensitive if server support [FEATURE_CONTEXT_SENSITIVE_CASE_CONVERSION](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_CONTEXT_SENSITIVE_CASE_CONVERSION) feature (supported by [TextServerAdvanced](TextServerAdvanced.md)).

\ **Note:** The result may be longer or shorter than the original.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **string_to_title**\ (\ string\: [String](String.md), language\: [String](String.md) = ""\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [](#TextServer_method_string_to_title)

Returns the string converted to title case.

\ **Note:** Casing is locale dependent and context sensitive if server support [FEATURE_CONTEXT_SENSITIVE_CASE_CONVERSION](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_CONTEXT_SENSITIVE_CASE_CONVERSION) feature (supported by [TextServerAdvanced](TextServerAdvanced.md)).

\ **Note:** The result may be longer or shorter than the original.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

Returns the string converted to uppercase.

\ **Note:** Casing is locale dependent and context sensitive if server support [FEATURE_CONTEXT_SENSITIVE_CASE_CONVERSION](TextServer.md#TextServer_constant_FEATURE_CONTEXT_SENSITIVE_CASE_CONVERSION) feature (supported by [TextServerAdvanced](TextServerAdvanced.md)).
